p: One of the large prospective studies conducted by Nellis and collaborators [ 36, 37] in hospitalized neonates in Europe described the administration of eight potentially harmful excipients of interest (EOI) (parabens, polysorbate 80, propylene glycol, benzoates, sodium saccharine, sorbitol, ethanol and benzalkonium chloride) and identified risk factors resulting from exposure. Neonates appear to lack the ability to conjugate benzoates with glycine, leading to the accumulation of benzoic acid that can cause metabolic acidosis and neurotoxicity [ 26, 27].
